net.rem.regression

Class RMAbstract

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.core.alg.AlgAbstract
      • net.hudup.core.alg.ExecutableAlgAbstract
        • net.rem.regression.RMAbstract
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote, java.util.EventListener, net.hudup.core.alg.Alg, net.hudup.core.alg.AlgRemote, net.hudup.core.alg.AlgRemoteTask, net.hudup.core.alg.ExecutableAlg, net.hudup.core.alg.ExecutableAlgRemote, net.hudup.core.alg.ExecutableAlgRemoteTask, net.hudup.core.alg.MemoryBasedAlg, net.hudup.core.alg.MemoryBasedAlgRemote, net.hudup.core.alg.MemoryBasedAlgRemoteTask, net.hudup.core.alg.SetupAlgListener, net.hudup.core.data.Exportable, net.hudup.core.logistic.Inspectable, RM, RMRemote, RMRemoteTask

    public abstract class RMAbstract
extends net.hudup.core.alg.ExecutableAlgAbstract
implements RM, RMRemote, net.hudup.core.alg.MemoryBasedAlg, net.hudup.core.alg.MemoryBasedAlgRemote
    This is the most abstract class for regression model. It implements partially the interface RM.
    Version:
    1.0*
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • coeffs

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.Double> coeffs
        Regression coefficient.

      • xIndices

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.Object[]> xIndices
        Indices for X data, including -1 such as (-1, 0 or #x1, 1 or log(#x1), ..., n-1 or xn). So x1 begins with index 1. Note, every element of xIndices is an array of objects. In current implementation, only the first object in such array is used, which can be index (the index -1 points to 1 value, not point to profile) or expression.

      • zIndices

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.Object[]> zIndices
        Indices for Z data, including -1 such as (-1, z). So z has index 1. Note, every element of zIndices is an array of objects. In current implementation, only the first object in such array is used, which can be index (the index -1 points to 1 value, not point to profile) or expression. However, zIndices has 2 elements.

      • attList

        protected net.hudup.core.data.AttributeList attList
        Attribute list for all variables: all X, Y, and z. This variable is also used as the indicator of successful learning.

      • extractRegressor

        public VarWrapper extractRegressor(int index)
                            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: RMRemoteTask
        Extracting regressor (X). In the most general case that each index is an mathematical expression, this method is focused.
        Specified by:
        extractRegressor in interface RMRemoteTask
        Parameters:
        index - specified index. Index 0 is not included in the profile because this specified index is in the parameter r_indices. So the index here is the second index, and of course it is number. Index starts from 1. So index 0 always indicates to null.
        Returns:
        regressor (X) extracted.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error raises.

      • extractRegressorValue

        public double extractRegressorValue(java.lang.Object input,
                                    int index)
                             throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: RMRemoteTask
        Extracting value of regressor (X) from specified profile. In the most general case that each index is an mathematical expression, this method is focused.
        Specified by:
        extractRegressorValue in interface RMRemoteTask
        Parameters:
        input - specified input. It is often profile. It can be an array of real values.
        index - specified index. Index 0 is not included in the profile because this specified index is in the parameter r_indices. So the index here is the second index, and of course it is number. Index starts from 1. So index 0 always indicates to value 1.
        Returns:
        value of regressor (X) extracted from specified profile.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error raises.

      • solve

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Double> solve(java.util.List<double[]> A,
                                                     java.util.List<java.lang.Double> b)
        Solving the equation Ax = b. This method uses firstly LU decomposition to solve exact solution and then uses QR decomposition to solve approximate solution in least square sense. Finally, if the problem of singular matrix continues to raise, MoorePenrose pseudo-inverse matrix is used to find approximate solution.
        Parameters:
        A - specified matrix.
        b - specified vector.
        Returns:
        solution x of the equation Ax = b. Return null if any error raises.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        default attribute list for sample to learn regression model.

      • generate2DRegressiveGaussianData

        public static LargeStatistics generate2DRegressiveGaussianData(java.util.List<double[]> alphas,
                                                               java.util.List<java.lang.Double> probs,
                                                               java.util.List<java.lang.Double> variances,
                                                               int size)
        Generating 2-dimensional regressive data with specified list of regression coefficients, list of probabilities, list of variances, and size.
        Parameters:
        alphas - specified list of regression coefficients.
        probs - specified list of probabilities.
        variances - specified list of variances.
        size - size of data.
        Returns:
        regressive large statistics generated from specified list of regression coefficients, list of probabilities, list of variances, and size.

      • generate2DRegressiveGaussianData2

        public static LargeStatistics generate2DRegressiveGaussianData2(java.util.List<double[]> alphas,
                                                                java.util.List<java.lang.Double> probs,
                                                                java.util.List<java.lang.Double> variances,
                                                                int size)
        Generating 2-dimensional regressive data with specified list of regression coefficients, list of probabilities, list of variances, and size.
        Parameters:
        alphas - specified list of regression coefficients.
        probs - specified list of probabilities.
        variances - specified list of variances.
        size - size of data.
        Returns:
        regressive large statistics generated from specified list of regression coefficients, list of probabilities, list of variances, and size.
